document.text: Context-based projection methods for identifying the translation of terms in comparable corpora has attracted a lot of attention in the community , e.g. ( Fung ,1998 ; Rapp , 1999 ) .
Surprisingly , none of those works have systematically investigated the impact of the many parameters controlling their approach .
The present study aims at doing just this .
As a testcase , we address the task of translating terms of the medical domain by exploiting pages mined from Wikipedia .

document.claim: significant gains can be obtained by using an association measure that is rarely used in practice
document.text: One interesting outcome of this study is that significant gains can be obtained by using an association measure that is rarely used in practice .
to Information Retrieval .

document.evidence: Our results show that using the log-odds ratio as the association measure allows for significantly better translation spotting than the log-likelihood .
document.text: Our results show that using the log-odds ratio as the association measure allows for significantly better translation spotting than the log-likelihood .

document.evidence: A closer look at the translation candidates obtained when using LL , the most popular association measure in projection-based approaches , shows that they are often collocates of the reference translation .
document.text: A closer look at the translation candidates obtained when using LL , the most popular association measure in projection-based approaches , shows that they are often collocates of the reference translation .
document.claim_evidence: A closer look at the translation candidates obtainedthey are often collocates of the reference translation

document.text: Therefore , LL may fare better in an indirect approach , like the one in ( Daille and Morin , 2005 ) .

document.text: Indeed , the values of the different parameters influence one another in most cases .
Parameters related to the seed lexicon ( size , domain specificity ) are not of great influence on the performance , but this may in part be due to our resources and the way they were built .

document.evidence: The highest Top 1 precision , 55.2 percent , was reached with the following parameters : sentence contexts , LO , cosine and a 9,000-entry mixed lexicon , with the use of a cognate heuristic .
document.text: The highest Top 1 precision , 55.2 percent , was reached with the following parameters : sentence contexts , LO , cosine and a 9,000-entry mixed lexicon , with the use of a cognate heuristic .

document.evidence: In future works , other parameters which influence the performance will be studied , among which the use of a terminological extractor to treat complex terms ( Daille and Morin , 2005 ) , more contextual window configurations , and the use of syntactic information in combination with lexical information ( Yu and Tsujii , 2009 ) .
document.text: In future works , other parameters which influence the performance will be studied , among which the use of a terminological extractor to treat complex terms ( Daille and Morin , 2005 ) , more contextual window configurations , and the use of syntactic information in combination with lexical information ( Yu and Tsujii , 2009 ) .

document.claim: It would also be interesting to compare the projection-basedgenerative model for bilingual lexicon acquisition from monolingual corpora
document.text: It would also be interesting to compare the projection-based approaches to ( Haghighi et al. , 2008 ) 's generative model for bilingual lexicon acquisition from monolingual corpora .

document.claim: Wikipedia is surprisingly suitable for mining medical terms
document.text: One latent outcome of this work is that Wikipedia is surprisingly suitable for mining medical terms .
